chi: （因為厭惡而）不能忍受，無法容忍
eng: If you can't abide someone or something, you dislike them very much.
chisen: 我真受不了她。
engsen: I can't abide her .

chi: （因為厭惡而）不能忍受，無法容忍
eng: If you can't abide someone or something, you dislike them very much.
chisen: 他無法容忍懶惰。
engsen: He couldn't abide laziness .

eng: to live or stay somewhere
chisen: 他在荒野中度過了40天。
engsen: He abided in the wilderness for forty days .

eng: to end an activity or custom officially
chisen: 我認為鬥牛應該廢止。
engsen: I think bullfighting should be abolished .

eng: to end an activity or custom officially
chisen: 英國的國民兵役制度於1962年廢止。
engsen: National Service was abolished in the UK in 1962 .

chi: （通常指透過手術進行的）墮胎，人工流產
eng: the intentional ending of a pregnancy
chisen: 她決定接受人工流產。
engsen: She decided to have/get an abortion .

chi: （通常指透過手術進行的）墮胎，人工流產
eng: the intentional ending of a pregnancy
chisen: 美國一些州禁止墮胎。
engsen: Abortion is restricted in some American states .

eng: a failure
chisen: 這個企劃案徹底失敗了。
engsen: This project is a complete abortion .

eng: sudden and unexpected, and often unpleasant
chisen: 突變／突發情況
engsen: an abrupt change/movement

eng: sudden and unexpected, and often unpleasant
chisen: 喬治突然衝進房間裡，我們的談話戛然而止。
engsen: Our conversation came to an abrupt end when George burst into the room .

eng: sudden and unexpected, and often unpleasant
chisen: 道路沿一個險峭陡坡俯衝到海邊，就到了盡頭。
engsen: The road ended in an abrupt (= sudden and very steep) slope down to the sea .

eng: using too few words when talking, in a way that seems rude and unfriendly
chisen: 唐突的舉止／生硬的回答
engsen: an abrupt manner/reply

eng: using too few words when talking, in a way that seems rude and unfriendly
chisen: 他有時對待客戶非常粗魯。
engsen: He is sometimes very abrupt with clients .

chi: 荒謬的，荒唐的；愚蠢的；可笑的
eng: stupid and unreasonable, or silly in a humorous way
chisen: 這話多荒唐啊！
engsen: What an absurd thing to say !

chi: 荒謬的，荒唐的；愚蠢的；可笑的
eng: stupid and unreasonable, or silly in a humorous way
chisen: 別說傻話了！我當然想讓你來。
engsen: Don't be so absurd ! Of course I want you to come .

chi: 荒謬的，荒唐的；愚蠢的；可笑的
eng: stupid and unreasonable, or silly in a humorous way
chisen: 這情形真是讓人哭笑不得——他們誰也不理睬誰。
engsen: It's an absurd situation - neither of them will talk to the other .

chi: 荒謬的，荒唐的；愚蠢的；可笑的
eng: stupid and unreasonable, or silly in a humorous way
chisen: 我戴這頂帽子是不是很滑稽？
engsen: Do I look absurd in this hat ?

eng: more than enough
chisen: 充足的食品供應
engsen: an abundant supply of food

eng: more than enough
chisen: 有充分證據顯示，汽車對環境有害。
engsen: There is abundant evidence that cars have a harmful effect on the environment .

eng: more than enough
chisen: 在這個地區，大量的低廉消費品充斥其間。
engsen: Cheap consumer goods are abundant (= exist in large amounts) in this part of the world .
